thread.title: President Hollande praises ‘rape’ victim | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: President Hollande praises ‘rape’ victim | Daily Mail Online

author: Dave Burke For Mailonline
title: President Hollande praises ‘rape’ victim | Daily Mail Online
text: President Hollande praises 'rape' victim sexually abused with a police truncheon as he visits him in hospital following riots which have spread across Paris Francois Hollande visited the young man, named Theo, in hospital Theo has undergone emergency surgery after being raped with a baton One officer has been charged with rape, and three with unnecessary violence Hollande praised the 'dignity and responsibility' of the victim Published: 10:21 GMT, 9 February 2017 | Updated: 12:23 GMT, 9 February 2017 322 shares comments French President Francois Hollande has visited a 22-year-old man who was allegedly raped with a police baton in a horrific incident that has sparked anger across the capital. Violence has spread across Paris following claims that the victim, named Theo, was assaulted with a baton when he was arrested by four police officers. The officers have been suspended pending an inquiry, with one under formal investigation for suspected rape and three others for unnecessary violence. French President Francois Hollande visited the victim, named Theo, in hospital, where he has undergone emergency surgery Protests have been held calling for justice for Theo, who was allegedly raped with a baton last Thursday A police officer has been charged with rape after a man was allegedly sodomised with a baton. The incident was purportedly caught on mobile phone footage RELATED ARTICLES
